      • getActions

        public List<ResourceToolAction> getActions(ResourceToolAction.ActionType type)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Access the action specified by the parameter. If the action is defined for this resource type, it is returned. Otherwise, the method returns null.
        Specified by:
        getActions in interface ResourceType
        Returns:

      • getActions

        public List<ResourceToolAction> getActions(List<ResourceToolAction.ActionType> types)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Access an ordered list of actions specified by the parameter. The actions are added to the list in the order specified by the parametric list. If none of the action types specified in the list are defined for this resource type, the returned list will be empty.
        Specified by:
        getActions in interface ResourceType
        Returns:

      • getIconLocation

        public String getIconLocation(ContentEntity entity)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Retrieve a reference for the location of the icon for this type. This should be relative to the image library in "/reference/library/src/webapp/image/". For example, the plain-text image is "sakai/text.gif"; If null, the mimetype of the resource or other info may be used to find an icon, which may be inappropriate for a particular resource type. In the case of folders and other expandable resources, the value returned by this method will be used for top-level folders within a site because, those folders are expanded by default.
        Specified by:
        getIconLocation in interface ResourceType
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity for which the icon is needed, or null, especially in cases where a specific entity has not yet been created.
        Returns:
        A path to the icon relative to the root of the image library in "/reference/library/src/webapp/image/", or null

      • getId

        public String getId()
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Access the identifier for this type (which must be unique within the registry and must be limited to alphnumeric characters).
        Specified by:
        getId in interface ResourceType
        Returns:

      • getLabel

        Specified by:

      • getLocalizedHoverText

        public String getLocalizedHoverText(ContentEntity entity)
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Access a text string suitable for use as a very brief description of a particular resource. If the string is more than about 40 or 50 characters, it may be truncated at an arbitrary length. The string may identify the type of this resource or more specific information. If the entity parameter is null, the method should return a more general description of the the entity (suitable for a new entity during creation dialogs). The string should be localized. If no return value is supplied, a default hover-string will be used.
        Specified by:
        getLocalizedHoverText in interface ResourceType
        Parameters:
        entity - The resource that's being displayed, or null indicating that the entity might not yet exist.
        Returns:

      • hasAvailabilityDialog

        public boolean hasAvailabilityDialog()
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Should the Resources tool support hiding and scheduled release and/or retraction for items of this type?
        Specified by:
        hasAvailabilityDialog in interface ResourceType
        Returns:
        true if availability is included among the resource properties in the UI, false otherwise.

      • isExpandable

        public boolean isExpandable()
        Description copied from interface: ResourceType
        Indicates whether this resource type is one for which an "expand" action is available. If this method returns true, the ResourceType registration must implement the ExpandableResourceType interface and provide action definitions of type "expand" and "collapse".
        Specified by:
        isExpandable in interface ResourceType
        Returns:

      • getSizeLabel

        public String getSizeLabel(ContentEntity entity)
        Returns null to indicate that the Resources tool should display the byte count or member count for the entity (depending on whether the entity is a ContentResource or ContentCollection). If a different measure of the "size" of the entity is needed, overrid this method to return a short string (no more than 18 characters) describing the "size" of the entity as appropriate.
        Specified by:
        getSizeLabel in interface ResourceType
        Parameters:
        entity - The resource that's being displayed, or null indicating that the entity might not yet exist.
        Returns:
        A short string describing the size of an entity, or null.
        See Also:
        ResourceType.MAX_LENGTH_SHORT_SIZE_LABEL

      • getLongSizeLabel

        public String getLongSizeLabel(ContentEntity entity)
        Returns null to indicate that the Resources tool should display the byte count or member count for the entity (depending on whether the entity is a ContentResource or ContentCollection). If a different measure of the "size" of the entity is needed, overrid this method to return a short string (no more than 80 characters) describing the "size" of the entity as appropriate.
        Specified by:
        getLongSizeLabel in interface ResourceType
        Parameters:
        entity - The resource that's being displayed, or null indicating that the entity might not yet exist.
        Returns:
        A short string describing the size of an entity, or null.
        See Also:
        ResourceType.MAX_LENGTH_LONG_SIZE_LABEL

      • setSizeLabeler

        public void setSizeLabeler(BasicResourceType.SizeLabeler labeler)
        Provide a SizeLabeler object to supply custom implementations of getSizeLabel(ContentEntity) and getLongSizeLabel(ContentEntity).
        Parameters:
        labeler -
